name: Mangodi Ki Sabzi
history: Mangodi Ki Sabzi is a staple dish in various parts of India, especially in Rajasthan. Made from sun-dried lentil dumplings (mangodi), it's a creative way to utilize preserved food in areas with limited vegetable availability.
description: This dish involves cooking mangodi, small sun-dried lentil dumplings, in a spicy and tangy gravy. It's a flavorsome and hearty dish, often served with rice or Indian bread.

instructions.title: Fry the Mangodi
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan and fry the mangodi until they turn golden brown. Remove and set aside.

instructions.title: Prepare the Masala
instructions.description: In the same pan, add cumin seeds. Once they crackle, add the chopped onions and ginger-garlic paste. Saut√© until the onions are translucent.

instructions.title: Cook the Gravy
instructions.description: Add the pureed tomatoes, turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the oil starts separating from the masala.

instructions.title: Add the Mangodi
instructions.description: Add the fried mangodi to the masala along with water. Bring to a boil, then simmer until the mangodi are cooked and the gravy thickens.

instructions.title: Finalize and Serve
instructions.description: Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice or Indian bread.

tips: Ensure the mangodi are fried to a golden brown to enhance their flavor.
Adjust the consistency of the gravy to your preference by adding more or less water.
variations: Add vegetables like peas or carrots for a nutritious twist.
Experiment with different types of mangodi for variety.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave, adding a little water if needed.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional bowl, garnished with cilantro.
Accompany with freshly made chapati or steamed rice.
